variable.name: F157VY
variable.comment: Visit year in which this form was collected.

variable.name: F157X2VY
variable.comment: WHI Extension 2 visit year for which this form was collected.

variable.name: F157DAYS
variable.description: F157 Days since randomization or enrollment

variable.name: LIVALN
variable.comment: Please mark the circle that best describes your current living arrangement.

variable.name: ALZREL
variable.comment: Has any member of your family (mother, father, full-blooded sister or brother) been diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease or senile dementia?

variable.name: ALZMOM
variable.comment:
Usage Notes: Sub-question of F157 V1 Q3 'Has any member of your family (mother, father, full-blooded sister or brother) been diagnosed_x000D_
with Alzheimer's disease or senile dementia?'

variable.name: LACKCMPSHP
variable.comment: How often do you feel that you lack companionship?

variable.name: LEFTOUT
variable.comment: How often do you feel left out?

variable.name: ISOLATED
variable.comment: How often do you feel isolated from others?

variable.name: EXPCTBST
variable.comment: In unclear times, I usually expect the best.

variable.name: WRONG
variable.description: If something can go wrong for me it will
variable.comment: If something can go wrong for me, it will.

variable.name: HOPEFUL
variable.comment: I'm always hopeful about my future.

variable.name: NOTMYWAY
variable.description: Hardly ever expect things to go my way
variable.comment:
I hardly ever expect things to go_x000D_
my way.

variable.name: COUNTGD
variable.comment: I rarely count on good things happening to me.

variable.name: MOREGOOD
variable.comment: Overall, I expect more good things to happen to me than bad.

variable.name: GOALS
variable.comment: I feel that it is impossible to reach the goals I would like to strive for.

variable.name: HOPELESS
variable.comment: The future seems to me to be hopeless, and I can't believe that things are changing for the better.

variable.name: OPTIMISM
variable.comment: Computed from Form 157 questions 5.1-5.6. Source: Life Orientation Test-Revised (LOT-R). Sum of six components coded from 1=strongly disagree to 5=strongly agree. Questions 5.2, 5.4 and 5.5 are reverse coded before summing. The summary score ranges from 6 to 30 where a higher score indicates greater optimisim. Missing if any of the six components is missing.
